newsitem.title: GERMANY: Siemens CEO sees profit growth in 98/99.
newsitem.headline: Siemens CEO sees profit growth in 98/99.

text.p: Siemens AG chief executive Heinrich von Pierer said on Monday profits in the current business year would at least match the previous year's results and that earnings would expand further in the next few years.
Siemens had previously said it would match profit levels of the 1995/96 business year in the year that is due to end on September 30.
"Taking a look at the first nine months of the current year, we are certain that we will at least reach this target," said Pierer in the text of a speech to be delivered at the annual news confernce.
He predicted sales in 1996/97 would rise to 102 billion marks, while orders would rise to 108 billion marks.
Losses in health care and transportation would be offset by profit increases in computers, communications and industry.
"In contrast to the current year, we expect a significant rise in 1998/99 net income, one that will be notably higher than the growth in business volume," he added.
